Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band near top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at top of rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers at in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.611) (Phase 3)
